intro: Anomalopterys zanzibarica, commonly known as the Zanzibar sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Anomalopterys zanzibarica is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline.
